monsters.name: Arya
monsters.description: The Queen of the Wode. A gargantuan fox who converses with her all-seeing children (the Palims) through hidden strings of code. If you find her, perform a /bow and offer anything of value. She can guide you where you need to go

special.name: Arya's Shroud
special.effect: On her initiative, Arya drags a single player into her shroud, a foggy one-on-one arena. They leave at the beginning of Arya's next turn if she chooses a new victim.

drops.name: Arya's Cloak
drops.effect: Legendary Item. The wearer gains a +5 bonus to Lore roles if they are wearing green IRL.

monsters.name: Beam Lords
monsters.description: The floating eyes of Annwn, grown agitated in their disconnected life.

special.name: Status Beam
special.effect: Target player is hit with a random status at the start of the Beam Lord's turn. These can stack if hit more than once.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Black Hounds
monsters.description: The Drowned King's spectral hounds. Designed like polygonal anubis hounds, each with an array of floating orbs around their neck denoting the number of avatars they've eaten

special.name: Drown
special.effect: Target player is grappled by the Black Hound and is treated as if they are drowning.

drops.name: Castle Invite
drops.effect: Invitation to the Drowned King's Castle

monsters.name: Brainwurms
monsters.description: Tangled cords of brain fold, writhing around their prey to swallow them whole.

special.name: Bleed
special.effect: Target player is given the bleed status effect at the start of the Brainwurm's turn.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Brutalizers
monsters.description: Disembodied hands, each with eight fingers. They come in pairs, using teamwork to grab avatars and pull them apart, limb from limb

special.name: Copycat
special.effect: The Brutalizer's next attack deals the same damage type as was last done to them.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Constructs
monsters.description: Polyhedral bits and bobbles that have collided, clipped, and meshed together. They constantly destroy and build off one another.

special.name: Rebuild
special.effect: At the beginning of their turn, a Construct can build onto itself using the remains of its companions. The dice that are defeated can be reclaimed at a rate of one per turn.

monsters.name: Dragons
monsters.description: Children of Annwn that explode from her body and conquer the hex of their birth. Stylized after the lung Dragons.

special.name: Breath Weapon
special.effect: At the end of the round, the Dragon breathes its fire onto the battlefield, forcing everyone to make a contest against its current dice.

monsters.name: Dreamer
monsters.description: Sleeping giants with egg-like heads, cracked and open to reveal a hollowness inside.

special.name: Dream
special.effect: At the end of each round, more and more Dream Jellies crawl from the Dreamer's head to join combat. First one, then two, then three, and so on.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Dregs
monsters.description: Feathered velociraptor creatures that travel quickly across all terrains and hunt solo players in packs.

special.name: Overwhelm
special.effect: Each individual dreg rolls a dice during their turn and deals that damage directly to Sync.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Giant Bats
monsters.description: Big furry beasts with bat wings and human-like appendages. They carry machine guns.

special.name: Flight
special.effect: Giant Bats hover above the battlefield, always keeping themselves at range from groundborn opponents.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Goblins
monsters.description: Little critters. Mischievous folks. Dastardly pals.

special.name: Snatch
special.effect: Goblins will forgo doing damage to grapple, hog-tie, and haul players away toward the nearest Dragon.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Dream Jelly
monsters.description: Gelatinous lumps. Oozes and the sort. Each with their own elemental affinity. They split down the dice chain as they are attacked.

monsters.name: Neon Jelly
monsters.description: Gelatinous lumps. Oozes and the sort. Each with their own elemental affinity. They split down the dice chain as they are attacked.

special.name: City
special.effect: Neon Jellies get an extra +1 against people who live in big cities.

monsters.name: Shadow Jelly
monsters.description: Gelatinous lumps. Oozes and the sort. Each with their own elemental affinity. They split down the dice chain as they are attacked.

special.name: Darkness
special.effect: Shadow Jellies get an extra +1 when the sun is down.

monsters.name: Solar Jelly
monsters.description: Gelatinous lumps. Oozes and the sort. Each with their own elemental affinity. They split down the dice chain as they are attacked.

special.name: Sunlight
special.effect: Solar Jellies get an extra +1 while the sun is out.

monsters.name: Manticores
monsters.description: Wizard hunters, spell learners, and chimeric beasts. Tiger claws and body, snake for a tail, and a crow's beaked head.

special.name: Overwhelm
special.effect: On its turn, the Manticore rolls all of its remaining dice and deals that damage to Sync.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Palims
monsters.description: Little forest critters. The children of the forest. They look dopey in the cutest way possible, fumbling and tumbling around with their clumsy movements.

special.name: Blessing
special.effect: If you're nice to them, they'll give you a d10 you can add to any contest you want.

monsters.name: Princess
monsters.description: Weird, floating, Alice-in-Wonderland person. Always spins a parasol and giggles incessantly.

special.name: Knighty Knight
special.effect: At the beginning of her turn, summons a d12 Knight to protect her.

monsters.name: PUG
monsters.description: Players Unknown. The other people playing this game with you. Roll on the PUG tables to figure out who they are. Give them an aspect too!

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: PUG Moderator
monsters.description: Players Unknown. The other people playing this game with you. Roll on the PUG tables to figure out who they are. Give them an aspect too!

monsters.name: PVP PUG
monsters.description: Players Unknown. The other people playing this game with you. Roll on the PUG tables to figure out who they are. Give them an aspect too!

monsters.name: Sagas
monsters.description: Imagine a cat standing on its hind legs with its torso stretched all the way out. They wear capes and their eyes glow.

special.name: Hypnosis
special.effect: Target player is charmed by the Saga.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Saga Princes
monsters.description: They come from storm clouds. The envoys of the Cat Queen herself.

special.name: Theron
special.effect: Can summon the Theron (a big liger) to help them in combat. Fights with 3d6.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Scarecrows
monsters.description: Little puffy crows that explode when attacked.

special.name: Pop
special.effect: If destroyed in melee, roll their dice as damage as they explode.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Skeletons
monsters.description: Those boney boys. The remnants of old NPCs and abandoned accounts

special.name: Reassemble
special.effect: A Skeleton will reassemble itself in a day if not destroyed with a solar weapon.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Shadow Skeletons
monsters.description: Only the oldest accounts create Shadow Skeletons when they're abandoned.

special.name: Thorns
special.effect: You take 1 Sync damage when rolling a contest against a Shadow Skeleton, on account of them being full of thorny roses.

monsters.name: Snakes
monsters.description: Big snakes. You've heard of them.

special.name: Absorb
special.effect: Snakes absorb spells that are cast in combat, giving them an extra d10 to their next contest or damage roll.

special.name: Halfgan's Snake
special.effect: Starts with 5d10

monsters.name: Spiders
monsters.description: They're friendly if you don't attack them. Toggling arachnophobia in the Help Menu replaces them with dogs.

special.name: Web
special.effect: Target player is webbed and given the paralyzed status.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Spider Priests
monsters.description: Brutalizers that walk on two fingers, dressed in horrifying robes. They are forever searching for their god.

special.name: Summon
special.effect: At the end of the round, each spider priest summons a Spider.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Vorths
monsters.description: Disembodied mouths, each with their own uniquely generated lips and teeth.

special.name: Swallow
special.effect: Target is swallowed and given the grappled status.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Walls of Flesh
monsters.description: A red and pink mass of flesh covered in eyes, arms, and mouths.

special.name: Everywhere
special.effect: While in combat, a Wall of Flesh counts as being within range of everything.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table

monsters.name: Wolves
monsters.description: Ancient beings who know the human tongue.

special.name: Pack Tactics
special.effect: A Wolf's bonus is equal to the number of Wolves present.

monsters.name: Zombies
monsters.description: Decaying undead. Generated whenever a player is forced to respawn.

special.name: Attraction
special.effect: At the end of each round, d4 more Zombies enter combat.

drops.name: standard
drops.effect: Roll RNG on Universal Drops table
